org.judal.ramqueue

Class RAMQueueProducer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.judal.ramqueue.RAMQueueProducer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer

    public class RAMQueueProducer
extends Object
implements org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer

    RecordQueueProducer interface implementation.

    This implementation instantiates an in-memory RAMQueueConsumer and a DataSource for processing the produced messages.
    Author:
    Sergio Montoro Ten

        public void insert(org.judal.storage.table.Record oRec,
                   org.judal.storage.Param[] aParams)
            throws javax.jdo.JDOException,
                   IllegalStateException

        Perform asynchronous insert operation.

        There must not exist another Record with the same primary key in the target table.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer
        Parameters:
        oRec - Record Instance of a Record subclass
        aParams - Param[] Parameters to be binded
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the queue is closed
        javax.jdo.JDOException - If another Record already exists with the same primary key

      • insert

        public void insert(org.judal.storage.table.Record oRec,
                   org.judal.storage.Param[] aParams,
                   Properties oProps)
            throws javax.jdo.JDOException

        Perform synchronous or asynchronous insert operation.

        There must not exist another Record with the same primary key in the target table.
        Specified by:
        insert in interface org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer
        Parameters:
        oRec - Record Instance of a Record subclass
        aParams - Param[] Parameters to be binded
        oProps - Properties If property "synchronous" is set to "true" then the operation will be performed synchronously using the current thread otherwise the insert operation will be sent to the RAMQueueConsumer queue.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the queue is closed
        javax.jdo.JDOException - If another Record already exists with the same primary key

        update in interface org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer
        Parameters:
        oRec - Record Instance of a Record subclass
        aParams - Param[] Values to be updated
        aWhere - Param[] Values for the filter clause defining the records to be updated
        oProps - Properties If property "synchronous" is set to "true" then the operation will be performed synchronously using the current thread otherwise the update operation will be sent to the RAMQueueConsumer queue.

        public void store(org.judal.storage.table.Record oRec)
           throws javax.jdo.JDOException

        Perform asynchronous store operation.

        A store operation will update the given Record if it already exists or insert it if no previous record with the same primary key exists.

        Perform synchronous or asynchronous delete operation.

        There must not exist another Record with the same primary key in the target table.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer
        Parameters:
        oRec - Record Instance of a Record subclass
        aKeys - String[] Values of the primary keys of the records to be deleted

      • stop

        public void stop(boolean bInmediate,
                 int iTimeout)
          throws javax.jdo.JDOException

        Wait for a certain time and call close.

        Specified by:
        stop in interface org.judal.storage.queue.RecordQueueProducer
        Parameters:
        bInmediate - boolean If true

        Then ignore iTimeout and stop immediately.
        iTimeout - int Time to wait in milliseconds before stopping.
        Throws:
        javax.jdo.JDOException
